job.title: Senior Project Manager
job.industry: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing,Information Technology and Services,Computer Software
job.description:
Overview
We continue to experience rapid growth as we invest in resources and create new opportunities, as a result, we have exciting opportunities for a
Sr. Software Engineering Project Manager
to join our PMO team in
Rockleigh, NJ 07647.
Seeking a talented and experienced Sr. Software Engineering Project Manager to make a difference and be part of a collaborative team that works to build innovative products. In this position, you will be responsible for managing large and small technical programs across various software groups within the organization. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of successfully planning and executing complex product development programs from concept to launch.
Responsibilities
Work cross-functionality to plan and track software.
Create development schedule, identify critical path, and maintain throughout execution.
Ensure excellent inter-team coordination and communication.
Understand complex technical items and abstract issues/risks into actionable items
Effectively and consistently communicate overall program status to teams and executives.
Qualifications
A minimum of Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science or related technical field is preferred
Ideal candidate will have combined experience of at least 10 years within the software or high-tech electronics industry in the capacity of either a software developer or design engineer and later as a development manager or project manager/lead.
Well-versed and proven success utilizing Agile and waterfall project management principles
Must be a proven leader of teams and development projects
A minimum of 5 years of Project Management experience is required.
Effective working across the full software lifecycle and across engineering disciplines and product lines is required
Technical depth and demonstrated experience in software development, including object oriented design and development is required
Software / Systems integration experience, including interface definition, system configuration, and leading system execution is required
Working knowledge of software engineering processes and development lifecycles is required.
Excellent communication, presentation, organizational and leadership skills is required
Motivated, team-oriented individual with strong problem-solving abilities is required
MS Engineering Management and/or PMP certification a plus
EOE/M/F/D/V
Benefits
At Crestron Electronics, we offer a competitive total compensation package including medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance and Short Term Disability. 401K with company contribution, Paid Vacation, Holidays and more!
We have new onsite state of the art fitness and wellness centers at our Headquarters in Rockleigh, NJ.
Must be able to work in the US without sponsorship
No Solicitation*
Any agency submittal to any and all employees of Crestron Electronics, Inc by any method of communication will be deemed, the sole property of Crestron Electronics Inc.
